intro: Bignonia floribunda, commonly known as the yellow bell vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its long, pendulous yellow flowers that resemble small bells, which bloom in spring and early summer. The plant has heart-shaped, opposite leaves that are typically green and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Bignonia floribunda is often grown as a climbing vine due to its vigorous growth habit and ornamental value.
